Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Cloth Diapers & Training Pants

The rules cited in the previous slide also include some revisions regarding the use of cloth diapers and training pants for licensed providers. These also serve as recommended practices for license exempt providers.

  • Cover with Outer Waterproof Covering

    Each cloth diaper must be covered with a waterproof covering.

  • Outer covering NOT to be Reused

    The outer covering must be removed as a singular unit with wet or soiled diapers and training pants.

  • Rinsing of contents not allowed on site

    Rinsing the contents must not occur at the center or child care home.

  • Soiled items in plastic lined covered container

    Soiled diapers must be placed in a plastic-lined, covered container, wet bag, or other waterproof container, and used only for that childâ€™s soiled diapers. Family homes must place in an individual, securely tied plastic bag.

  • Avoid contamination in storage and handling

    Soiled items must be handled and stored in a manner that does not contaminate any other items and must not be accessible to children.

  • Remove soiled items each day

    Soiled diapers and training pants must be removed from the child care site every day by the parents.

  • Supply to be used only for one child

    A childâ€™s supply of clean diapers and training pants may only be used for that child.

  • Toilet training plan by caregiver & parent

    Toilet learning or training must be planned cooperatively between the childâ€™s regular caregiver and the childâ€™s parent or guardian so the toilet routine established is consistent between the program and the childâ€™s home.

  • Equipment cleaned and sanitized daily

    All toilet seats and equipment used for toilet training must be washed, rinsed and sanitized daily. Best practice would include disinfecting as well.
